qas.question: Outside what city did the Battle of Borodino occur?
On what date did the Battle of Borodino take place?
Approximately how many Russians were hurt, killed, or captured in the Battle of Borodino?
Around how many French were killed, injured, or taken prisoner in the Battle of Borodino?
Who won the Battle of Borodino?

context: The Russians eventually offered battle outside <a0_0>Moscow<a0_0/> on <a1_0>7 September<a1_0/>: the Battle of Borodino resulted in approximately <a2_0>44,000<a2_0/> Russian and <a3_0>35,000<a3_0/> French dead, wounded or captured, and may have been the bloodiest day of battle in history up to that point in time. Although <a4_0>the French<a4_0/> had won, the Russian army had accepted, and withstood, the major battle Napoleon had hoped would be decisive. Napoleon's own account was: "The most terrible of all my battles was the one before Moscow. The French showed themselves to be worthy of victory, but the Russians showed themselves worthy of being invincible."
